statements: UPDATE student_progress SET progress=50, grade=3.5 WHERE student_id=101
UPDATE student_progress SET course_id=201, progress=60 WHERE student_id=102
UPDATE student_progress SET progress = 80, grade = 3.5 WHERE student_id = 101 AND course_id = 201
UPDATE student_progress SET course_name = 'Database Systems', progress = 90 WHERE student_id = 102
UPDATE students SET first_name='Alice', last_name='Smith' WHERE student_id=1;
UPDATE courses SET instructor='Professor Johnson', credits=4 WHERE course_id=101;
UPDATE students SET email='john.doe@example.com', first_name='John' WHERE student_id=101;
UPDATE courses SET instructor='Dr. Smith', credits=4 WHERE course_id=200;
UPDATE students SET student_name = 'John Doe' WHERE student_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
UPDATE courses SET course_description = 'Introduction to Python Programming' WHERE course_id = '456e89b7-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
UPDATE students SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE student_id = '0072e2d1-7ba4-4d3f-bcb3-57d91a47b202';
UPDATE courses SET course_description = 'Updated course description', course_name = 'New Course Name' WHERE course_id = 'c0643506-832b-4f7e-8fe0-53e144571d51';
UPDATE Students SET student_name='John Doe', enroll_date='2023-01-31 08:00:00' WHERE student_id=1;
UPDATE Courses SET course_description='This is a new course description.', course_credits=4 WHERE course_id=5;
UPDATE Students SET student_name = 'Alice', email = 'alice@example.com' WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE Enrollments SET grade = 95.5, enrollment_date = '2022-01-30 12:00:00' WHERE enrollment_id = 15;
